clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Self-assessment vs. Assessment by Others of Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Agreement in Relatives' Assessment in Standardized Questionnaires of Patients Who Have Been Admitted to Intensive Care Compared to Patients Who Have Not Been Admitted to Intensive Care (ASTON Study)

brief_summary.textblock: We will test the results of standardized questionnaires for patients admitted to intensive care assessed by relatives/caregivers compared to the patient itself. Furthermore we will compare results with patients not admitted to intensive care.

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement in assessment of ICU patients
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of results of self-assessment versus assessment by others of standardized questionnaires of postoperative patients admitted to intensive care

secondary_outcome.measure: Agreement in assessment of ICU vs. non-ICU patients
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of results of assessment of questionnaires of ICU patients vs. non-ICU patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Agreement in assessment of non-ICU patients
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of results of self-assessment versus assessment by others of standardized questionnaires of postoperative patients not admitted to intensive care but to the normal ward

secondary_outcome.measure: Multivariate testing using the closeness of the relationship
secondary_outcome.description: It will be tested if the closeness of relationship patient - relative/caregiver changes the agreement, i.e. if the agreement is dependent or independent of the closeness of the relationship

other_outcome.measure: Definition of criteria which define an appropriate close relationship to receive a reliable test result
other_outcome.description: Test which closeness of relationship is sufficient to provide adequate test results compared with the patient's answers

arm_group.description: Postoperative patients who have been admitted to intensive care
Postoperative patients who have not been admitted to intensive care but to the normal ward

intervention.description: Health related quality of life measured with European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions 5 Level
The Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living

study_pop.textblock: Surgical patients with a high risk to be admitted to intensive care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with a postoperative risk to be admitted to intensive care
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient who is not able to fill out the questionnaires alone and independent
- patient without relatives or a caregiver who could answer the assessment after surgery

facility.name: Klinikum rechts der Isar, School of Medicine, Technical University of Munich

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized data will be made available to other researchers on reasonable request. A data share agreement will have to be signed by both parties. Examples of reasonable requests are: a metaanalysis in the field a research collaboration rerun the analysis Data will only be provided for the purpose requested and may not be used otherwise without authorization/agreement.
